thread.title: Cathay Pacific's business class 'early bird' fares for 2016 -
thread.title_full: Cathay Pacific's business class 'early bird' fares for 2016 - Australian Business Traveller

author: David Flynn
title: Cathay Pacific's business class 'early bird' fares for 2016 -
text:
Business travellers planning ahead for their 2016 trips can take advantage of some sharply-priced 'early bird' fares from Cathay Pacific.
On sale from today, the cut-price packages cover travel from 1 March to 30 November 2016 to more than 16 destinations across the UK, Europe and North America.
And while early bird deals are most often associated with economy, Cathay Pacific's roster is worth checking out for keen business class and premium economy pricing.
Some of the business class deals include Sydney-London return for $7,467 (including taxes and surcharges); Melbourne-Paris for $7,199, and Perth to New York at $7,060.
Cathay Pacific's timetable includes five daily flights from Hong Kong to both London and New York (including both JFK and Newark airports) – so there's ample flex in your schedule to break your journey in Hong Kong to take some meetings or just take some time off.
"North America is growing in popularity with Cathay Pacific passengers particularly from the east coast of Australia who are choosing to make their one stop en route to New York, Boston or Chicago in Hong Kong rather than transiting in Los Angeles" said Cathay Pacific’s General Manager Southwest Pacific, Nelson Chin.
Read: Ten great stopover cities for New York-bound travellers
For all the deals and details visit www.cathaypacific.com.au .
 we're @AusBT
About David Flynn David Flynn is the editor of Australian Business Traveller and a bit of a travel tragic with a weakness for good coffee, shopping and lychee martinis.
